thread.title: Sutton United order 6,000 extra pint glasses, extra toilets and a temporary stand ahead of FA Cup glamour tie against Arsenal
thread.title_full: Sutton United order 6,000 extra pint glasses, extra toilets and a temporary stand ahead of FA Cup glamour tie against Arsenal

author: sstreet
title: Sutton United order 6,000 extra pint glasses, extra toilets and a temporary stand ahead of FA Cup glamour tie against Arsenal

organizations.name: team news sutton united vs arsenal

text:
EFL Beer we go Sutton United order 6,000 extra pint glasses, extra toilets and a temporary stand ahead of FA Cup glamour tie against Arsenal 
Sun-backed Sutton are leaving nothing to chance ahead of the biggest match in their history on Monday By BEN HUNT Comments SUTTON is stirring as the Sun-backed non-league minnows prepare to face Arsenal on Monday night. 
The club have restocked their supply of commemorative half-scarfs, while the bar manager, Steve Prince, has ordered in 6,000 extra pint glasses. 4 The Sutton United bar has been restocked with 6,000 pint glasses for the visit of Arsenal 
He’s also ordered extra beer after the delirious U’s supporters drank the place dry of ale after their victory over Leeds in the last round of the FA Cup. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football gossip and transfers on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
It has been a case of all hands to the pump for this tiny club in South West London. 
Yesterday at their Gander Green Lane stadium, extra toilets were being delivered while a temporary stand to seat the away fans was erected. Related Stories IAN WRIGHT Arsenal have no excuses... Sutton's plastic pitch should suit Arsene Wenger's side down to the ground Team News Sutton United vs Arsenal team news: Wenger prepares his reserves to end the Cup fairytale Preview Sutton United vs Arsenal: What time does it kick-off, what TV channel is it on, and what is the latest team news? Sutt get tough Sutton United will give Arsenal flops more to wine about following Bayern Munich humiliation PLOTTING A CUPSET Lowly Sutton United get their ground ready for biggest match in their history as they train ahead of Arsenal FA Cup tie MARK IRWIN My night watching Bayern Munich v Arsenal at the Sutton United Members' Bar ahead of FA Cup clash WATCH OUT GUNNERS Sun-backed Sutton prepare for FA Cup tie vs Arsenal with game against Rooney in front of 664 fans 
Sutton employ just THREE full-time members of staff and have been forced to rely on an army of volunteers to ensure the match goes ahead smoothly. 
The club’s flag has taken pride of place over the council’s offices in nearby Cheam and local shops are getting behind Sutton’s boys by decorating their shop windows in the club’s colours. PA:Press Association Sutton are looking forward to welcoming the Gunners to Gander Green Lane PA:Press Association Sutton celebrate their win over Leeds in the dressing room Getty Images The stadium is having a temporary stand delivered for the match PA:Press Association Wire 4 Sutton United’s away dressing room might not be quite what the Gunners are expecting 
David Smith, managing director of Village Travel, said: “I hope they win because I am a Spurs fan!” 
It has been an eye-opener for the club’s stalwart chairman, Bruce Elliott, who has been involved with Sutton United for more than 50 years. 
He said: “My dad used to bring me down to games when I was a kid. Sutton United fans queue from 5am to get tickets for Arsenal match 
“There have been lots of lows, but now, thanks to this Cup money, we are getting the jobs done that we have never found money for.” 
Elliott could be forgiven for wanting to head for the beach to unwind after the match. 
But he said: “A holiday sounds like an attractive proposition — but we could be planning for a quarter-final tie or a fifth-round replay! 
“My dream would be away at Old Trafford. How good would that be?”
